decision_conditions: The removal of deadwood is not covered by the TPO process so there is no requirement to gain permission to remove this, but this is covered as a notification that work is intended to remove this deadwood from the Oak tree.

It is recommended that this Oak tree, T13 as shown on the Havering TPO plan 14/76 can be crown lifted to 4m, the large branch that is growing toward the property, 40 Barleycorn Way can be crown reduced by up to 3m and the remaining overhanging crown to the property 40 Barleycorn Way reduced by up to 2.5m to balance.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
description:
T1 = 1 X Oak Tree to Reduce Spread by 2.0/2.5Mtrs & Remove Deadwood.


Light Access
General Maintenance
